meanings.definition: Wof (verb): to bark or howl like a dog
meanings.sent1: The dog will wof loudly when the mail carrier arrives.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor's dog likes to wof at night.
meanings.sent3: I tried to wof like a dog, but it just made my throat sore.
meanings.sent4: The wof of the dog echoed through the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The wof of the dog pierced the silence, startling everyone nearby.

meanings.definition: Wof (noun): the sound made by a dog
meanings.sent1: The wof of the puppy was high-pitched and adorable.
meanings.sent2: I heard a distant wof in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent3: The wof of the dog woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The wof of the dog was like music to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The wof of the dog filled the air with excitement and joy.

meanings.definition: Wof (adjective): pertaining to or characteristic of a dog
meanings.sent1: The wof collar was designed specifically for dogs.
meanings.sent2: She had a wof toy that her dog loved to play with.
meanings.sent3: The wof blanket kept the puppy warm and cozy.
meanings.sent4: His wof behavior made everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The wof scent of the dog lingered in the room.
